description: Compliance guidelines for OTT streaming platforms (Netflix, Disney+, Hulu, HBO Max, Amazon Prime Video) in the United States market.

regional_notes.overview: US OTT platforms follow MPAA-style ratings but have more flexibility than broadcast TV. FCC regulations don't apply to streaming, but platforms self-regulate to maintain brand safety and subscriber trust.
regional_notes.content_ratings: TV-Y, TV-Y7, TV-G, TV-PG, TV-14, TV-MA ratings should be accurately assigned with content descriptors.

Kids (G).description: Content suitable for all ages on family streaming platforms like Disney+
prohibited: Any alcohol, tobacco, or drug references
Death or dying (beyond 'going away forever' metaphors)
general_requirements: Positive messaging about friendship, sharing, diversity
No unauthorized brand exposure in kids content (FTC compliance)

Teens (PG-13).description: Content for teenagers, equivalent to TV-PG/TV-14
prohibited: Strong profanity (F-word used sparingly if at all)
restricted: Alcohol in social contexts (not excessive drinking)
general_requirements: Content descriptors: V (violence), L (language), S (sexual content), D (suggestive dialogue)
Sensitive content warnings for heavy themes

prohibited: Content violating platform Terms of Service
general_requirements: Age gate required for TV-MA content
Content warnings for sensitive topics (sexual assault, suicide, abuse)

violence.notes: OTT has more latitude than broadcast. Context matters - violence in prestige drama rated differently than gratuitous content.

profanity.notes: Streaming allows more profanity than broadcast. F-word and other strong language acceptable in TV-MA content.

alcohol.notes: Generally permissive. Social drinking common in content. Avoid excessive drinking shown positively, especially for younger ratings.

tobacco.notes: Streaming platforms increasingly avoid tobacco. Disney+ famously avoids smoking. Historical context acceptable but will trigger content advisory.

drugs.notes: Drug use can be depicted in mature content but should not be promotional. Educational content about drugs is acceptable.

sexual_content.notes: Streaming allows more than broadcast. Brief nudity acceptable in TV-MA. Extended sexual content may require separate rating.

logos.notes: Product placement is common in streaming content. Ensure proper licensing for visible brands.

platform_specific_rules.content_ratings: Must accurately assign TV-Y through TV-MA ratings with appropriate descriptors
platform_specific_rules.accessibility: Closed captions and audio description required for many titles
platform_specific_rules.parental_controls: Platform must support parental controls for content filtering
platform_specific_rules.content_warnings: Trigger warnings required for sensitive content (suicide, sexual assault)
